body.p: Meredith Peyton your petiton states that he was at the last term of the Franklin Circuit Court fined in the sum of $20 -- and also between twelve & $15, costs. The offence of which he was charged was selling liquor. Your petitoner lives about ten or twelve miles from Frankfort on the waters of Flat Creek. He is a man of very limited means, and he knows not how to pay the fine except by sacrifices he is ill able to bear as he has a large family to support.

He has never been before the Court before for any offence for violating the law, before and hopes never to be again. He is ^now^ and has been heretofore a law abiding ^man^, is industrious and hardworking -- is not and has never been a dissipated in any respect whatever --
He respectfully asks that the fine be remitted excepting the costs &c which he will endeavor to pay.

Sworn to before me this 15th day of July 1863
James Harlan Jr C. C, C, K, D,
We the undersigned unite in the petition of Meredith Peyton.

H I Todd
D Meriwether
W F Parrent
R E Collins
R, B. Gillson
John M Harlan

M. Peyton's Petition
Remit all except costs &c
T. E. Bramlette
Govr
Franklin Cir Ct
$20 --
Remitted
4th Sept 1863
